html: Even though the promotion of licentiousness has provided an ample living for her and her ilk, their conscience troubles them. Pretending Jehovah doesn’t exist has until now been a convenient ploy, but it hasn’t succeeded in making him go away—he still seeks after them. Their taking advantage of his longsuffering toward them doesn’t mean he has given up on them: “I held out my hands all the day to a defiant people, who walk in ways that are not good, following their own imagination” (Isaiah 65:2); “They did what was evil in my eyes; they chose to do what was not my will” (Isaiah 66:4).
